Line 28: Line 28:
'''Autopackage''' is a [[free software|free]] computer [[package management system]] aimed at making it simple to create a package that can be installed on all [[Linux distribution]]s and have that package integrate well into the [[desktop environment]].
'''Autopackage''' is a [[free software|free]] computer [[package management system]] aimed at making it simple to create a package that can be installed on all [[Linux distribution]]s and have that package integrate well into the [[desktop environment]].
â
Autopackage is still under active development as of July 2007. Autopackage has been starting to gain popularity. High profile projects such as [[aMSN]] and [[Inkscape]] now offer an Autopackage installer, and the popular software website [[Freshmeat.net]] offers content submitters a field to put the URL of Autopackages. The list of available packages is very limited, and most program versions are obsolete (for example, the most recent Autopackage of [[GIMP]] is 2.2.6, even though Gimp is now at version 2.4.1, as of May 2008).<ref>[http://www.linux.com/articles/60124 Autopackage struggling to gain acceptance] </ref> <ref>[http://www.autopackage.org/packages/ Projects using Autopackage</ref> Currently, the only operating sysmtem to include autopackage by default is [[Super Ubuntu]]<ref>http://hacktolive.org/su</ref>.
+
Autopackage is still under active development as of July 2007. Autopackage has been starting to gain popularity. High profile projects such as [[aMSN]] and [[Inkscape]] now offer an Autopackage installer, and the popular software website [[Freshmeat.net]] offers content submitters a field to put the URL of Autopackages. The list of available packages is very limited, and most program versions are obsolete (for example, the most recent Autopackage of [[GIMP]] is 2.2.6, even though Gimp is now at version 2.4.1, as of May 2008)<ref>[http://www.linux.com/articles/60124 Autopackage struggling to gain acceptance] </ref> <ref>[http://www.autopackage.org/packages/ Projects using Autopackage</ref>. Currently, the only operating sysmtem to include autopackage by default is [[Super Ubuntu]]<ref>http://hacktolive.org/su</ref>.
